titlestmt.subtitle: Records, 1886-1959
titlestmt.author: Collection processed and described by Rebecca Pou

note.p: Preliminary processing and description done by Donald Prochera, 2007.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Rebecca Pou, October 10, 2008.

repository.corpname: New York Academy of Medicine Library. Rare Book Room.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Hospital Graduates' Club Records. Rare Book Room, New York Academy of Medicine Library.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Hospital Graduates' Club was formed in 1886 for the purpose of "the advancement of medical science, and of the mutual interest of its members." Hospital graduates of one year were eligible for membership. Active membership was limited to 50 members, and associate membership was available for those who were restricted by time or location from participating in the New York based club. The club held monthly meetings October through June and annual dinners. Meetings were comprised of organizational business and presentations of papers and cases.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records include minutes of general meetings and the Board of Trustees, manuscript and printed copies of the constitution, printed programs and menus, memorials, correspondence, and other materials. Many of the minutes are handwritten, while those found in the "Permanent Minutes and Records" are typescript.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the catalog of The New York Academy of Medicine Library. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

controlaccess.subject: Medicine -- New York (State) -- New York -- Societies, etc.
